sentences: Kapten Smith juhtis laeva ohutiselt sadamasse.
Meie kooli teatrietenduse peaosas oli kapten.
context: The word 'kapten' in Estonian is a loanword from English/German meaning captain. It refers to the person in command of a ship, aircraft, or military unit. In Estonian, it maintains its masculine gender form and is typically used without inflection when referring to the profession or rank.
